00063 // ========================================================================
00064 //                                      Implementation of inlined methods =
00065 
00066 inline uint8
00067 FilteredCoord::getFilterLevel( const MC2Coordinate& coord )
00068 {
00069    // Last 2 bits of latitude and longitude are used for storing filter level
00070    
00071    //uint32 nrOflsbsToBeUsed = 2;
00072    //int lsbMask = ( 0xffffffff >> nrOflsbsToBeUsed ) << nrOflsbsToBeUsed;
00073    //int lsbInvertMask = 0xffffffff - lsbMask;
00074    
00075    uint8 filterLevel = uint8( coord.lat & 0x00000003 );
00076    filterLevel = (filterLevel << 2);
00077    filterLevel += uint8( coord.lon & 0x00000003 );
00078    
00079    return filterLevel;
00080 }
00081 
00082 inline uint8 FilteredCoord::getFilterLevel() const
00083 {
00084    return getFilterLevel(*this);
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 inline bool
00089 FilteredCoord::setFilterLevel( uint8 level )
00090 {
00091    // Last 2 bits of latitude and longitude are used for storing filter level
00092    // This makes level > 15 impossible
00093    if ( level > 15 )
00094       return false;
00095    
00096    //uint32 nrOflsbsToBeUsed = 2;
00097    //int lsbMask = ( 0xffffffff >> nrOflsbsToBeUsed ) << nrOflsbsToBeUsed;
00098    //int setLevelMask = 0xffffffff - lsbMask + 1;
00100    
00101    int lsbMask = 0xfffffffc;
00102    int setLevelMask = 0x00000004;
00103    
00104    lat = ( lat & lsbMask ) + ( level / setLevelMask );
00105    lon = ( lon & lsbMask ) + ( level % setLevelMask );
00106    
00107    return true;
00108 }
